title: There is no justifying dying more than twice to your lane opponent completely 1v1.

replies.body: Maybe you pushed an advantage and got outplayed... for the second time

Obviously I meant it.

I died once, I was outplayed. I died twice cos he burned everything to get me.

I died the third time so he could get on a spree, then share more gold with all the assists from a muliti-player gank on him while he had no summoners.

Get on my lvl scrublord!

This post makes the issue of feeding two kills as if it breaks the laws of logic and physics. 
The reason is because they played bad! Duh!
This is what I'm saying though, you die once, sure was a mistake/misplay. You die twice, another misstep or they burned everything to get to you. Third time would be just foolishness..
you die once. they get ahead. they then burn everything to get another kill on you. and they're further ahead. the cycle continues.
So don't fight or put yourself in a position where they can get to you and kill you
It happens all the time so who cares?
That makes it a lot worse...

The internet's full of things you can't explain.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=09m0B8RRiEE
Maybe they kill you due to being so ahead, who knows.

If they're so ahead, play uber passive, if they're smart and are pushing you off the wave, call for a lane swap, or if you have a champion who's good at doing so, do a couple of camps or ask for ganks. There are always ways around it.
